title: Introduction & Context
bullets: AI assistant for SRE/DevOps incident triage
Targets noisy microservice observability signals
Unifies logs, metrics, traces to speed MTTR

title: Motivation
bullets: High MTTR from fragmented signals
Alert fatigue and false positives
Slow root-cause isolation across services/releases

title: Key Features Envisioned
bullets: AI incident chat with evidence citations
Auto-correlated alerts → probable RCA
One-click playbooks & canary rollback
Postmortem draft with timeline

title: Solution Design
bullets: Architecture (text): Client UI → API GW → Orchestrator → Agents (Log/Trace/Config/Remediation) → Observability DB + Config repo; Kafka bus; VPC
Sequence (text): Alert fires → Orchestrator fans out → Agents fetch/analyze → Merge findings + risk score → UI suggests fix/playbook → Optional rollout via CI/CD hook

title: Tools, Tech, Languages, Models
bullets: TS/React UI; Go microservices; Python agents
FastAPI, gRPC, Temporal workflows
Models: Llama-3 70B API + local 8B; Milvus vector search
Infra: Docker, K8s, Helm; OAuth2/JWT

title: Cloud Platform, DevOps, Scaling
bullets: AWS EKS + RDS + S3 + CloudWatch + MSK
CI/CD: GitHub Actions → Helm → Argo Rollouts
Autoscale: HPA CPU/RPS, queue-based agent scaling, Redis cache
IaC: Terraform modules per environment

title: AI Agents & Effectiveness
bullets: Log Analyzer: anomaly clustering; ~30% fewer false positives
Trace Summarizer: bottleneck ranking; ~25% faster RCA
Config Diff Agent: flags risky changes; blocked 2 staging regressions
Remediation Agent: rollback/feature-flag suggestions; human-in-loop
